mechanoreception.notes: Nematodes generally possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch and movement in their environment. This is inferred due to their lifestyle in marine sediments.

chemoreception.notes: Nematodes are known to use chemoreception to locate food sources and mates. This is inferred due to their lifestyle in marine sediments.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Comesomatidae is unknown.
